page.title: 11POINTON-RELIGION & EDUCATION
page.content: {SEMPRINGHAM} At Sempringham mentioned in the 1st Domesday Book is the site of an abbey founded by Gilbert for Nuns and Monks. Following the Dissolution of Henry 8th,the great priory fell into ruins. Only the Church with its tower crowned with 8 pinnacles remains to serve the parish of Pointon. {EDUCATION The school,completed in 1892,has 64 pupils taught by 3 full-time and 1 part-time teacher. A new toilet block was built in 1979 and a new hall is scheduled 1986.The catchment area includes Dowsby,Dunsby, Rippingale and Aslackby. The pupils leave at 11 to go to Sleaford,Bourne or Billingborough. Music is a feature of the school and their enthusiastic teacher encourages recorder,guitar and percussion groups.
